atlas.controller

Class LoginController

  • java.lang.Object
    • atlas.controller.BasicController
      • atlas.controller.LoginController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @SessionScoped
 @Named(value="loginController")
public class LoginController
extends BasicController
implements Serializable
    Manages user login and privileges. SessionScoped managed bean, controller for login_bar.xhtml component.
    Author:
    Michal Smrha
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginController

        public LoginController()

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public String login()
        Attempts to log a user based on bound "userName" and "password". Also sets user privileges such as "editor". If there's a match, refreshing redirect is returned. If there's no match, FaceMessage is set and redirect is null.
        Returns:
        Redirection string.

      • logout

        public String logout()
        Logs out current user. Sets current user to null, "logged" flag and all privileges to false. Refreshes current page.
        Returns:
        Redirection string.

      • getCurrentUser

        public AtlasUser getCurrentUser()
        Returns:
        Currently logged user.

      • getPassword

        public String getPassword()
        Returns:
        Password.

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(String password)
        Parameters:
        password - Password to be used for "login()".

      • getUserName

        public String getUserName()
        Returns:
        User name.

      • setUserName

        public void setUserName(String userName)
        Parameters:
        userName - User name to be used for "login()".

      • isLogged

        public boolean isLogged()
        Returns:
        True if a user is logged in, otherwise false.

      • isEditor

        public boolean isEditor()
        Returns:
        True if a user with editor's rights is logged in, otherwise false.
